form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To improve transparency and efficiency with respect to audits and communications between taxpayers and the Internal Revenue Service.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Taxpayer Transparency and Efficient Audit Act.

section.header: Deadline for responses to taxpayer correspondence
section.text: Not later than 30 days after receiving any written correspondence from a taxpayer, the Internal Revenue Service shall provide a substantive written response. For purposes of the preceding sentence, an acknowledgment letter shall not be treated as a substantive response.

section.header: Taxpayer notification of disclosures by IRS of taxpayer information

subsection.text: Not later than 30 days after disclosing any taxpayer information to any agency or instrumentality of Federal, State, or local government, the Internal Revenue Service shall provide a written notification to the taxpayer describing—

paragraph.text: to whom it was disclosed, and

subsection.text: Subsection (a) shall not apply if the Secretary of the Treasury, or the Secretary’s designee, determines that such notification would be detrimental to an ongoing criminal investigation or pose a risk to national security.

section.header: Deadline for conclusion of audits of individual taxpayers
section.text: If any audit of a tax return of an individual by the Internal Revenue Service is not concluded before the end of the 1-year period beginning on the date of the initiation of such audit, the Internal Revenue Service shall provide the taxpayer a written letter explaining why such audit has taken more than 1 year to complete.
No additional funds are authorized to carry out the requirements of this Act. Such requirements shall be carried out using amounts otherwise authorized or appropriated.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives February 25, 2014.
